name: Mark J. Clement
content: Dr. Mark Clement Brigham Young University Computer Science Department Dr. Mark Clement Computer Science Department, 3374 TMCB Brigham Young University Provo UT 84602-6576 801.422.7608 Fax: 801.422.7775 clement@cs.byu.edu Bio Dr. Mark Clement received his PhD in Computer Science from Oregon State University in 1994. His BS and MS degrees in Electrical Engineering are from Brigham Young University. He also was a founder for ICON, a startup company which produced disk servers and database machines. He also worked for Digital Equipment Corporation and Intel as a software engineer. He currently manages the Family History Technology Laboratory ( FHTL) and is interested in developing applications to lower the entry barrier to family history. Research Interests Deep learning for handwriting recognition in historical documents Application to help users explore their family history Ways to help people with limited vision to participate in family history research. Classes I teach CS 260 - Web Programming CS 235 - Data Structures CS 224 - Machine Organization
